image.altText: A woman's hands hold a key ring while resting on a park bench.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old NSW border resident says dismissive treatment in hospitals, long waits for care and limited access to services have pushed her away from support.

title.children: Patient says 'traumatising' hospital care deepened her mental health crisis

image.altText: a wide shot of a flat beach, with a small headland in the distance.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man speaks of rescuing three people from rough water on his paddleboard, including a 34-year-old man who was declared dead after he was brought onto the beach.

title.children: Two drownings in two days along NSW South Coast as man dies at Jervis Bay

image.altText: Police tape in the foreground, a police car near a home in the distance.

props.synopsis: NSW Police launch an investigation after an unidentified woman was found dead in a home in Goulburn on Saturday morning.

title.children: NSW Police investigating woman's death at Goulburn home

image.altText: Artificial intelligence is growing smarter

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is a controversial subject, but as the debate rages it is already being used by ACT government departments, doctors and the people running firefighting operations.

title.children: How you're already relying on AI, even if you think you're not

image.altText: Girl in a light blue shirt and helmet on a brown horse

props.synopsis: As the Tumbarumba Rodeo celebrates its 80th year, the Rial family have held on for the longest ride of them all.

title.children: Snowy Mountains rodeo celebrates 80 years

image.altText: Three uniformed police officers walking on a road blocked off with orange cones.

props.synopsis: In just four minutes, two men were stabbed in the chest and customers inside the Queanbeyan hair salon were left shaken.

title.children: Bikies allegedly sat waiting in hair salon before stabbing two men

image.altText: Two men kissing in front of a car.

props.synopsis: What started as a chance discovery of an old photo at a Dallas antique store has spawned a collection of more than 4,000 images of male couples, more than 100 of which are now on display in Canberra.

title.children: It was a photo that, if leaked, was illegal. Now it's on public display

props.synopsis: Fast to build, eco-friendly and affordable: modular and pre-fabricated homes have been touted as a possible solution to Australia's housing crisis, but manufacturers and suppliers say changes are needed to reduce costs and meet demand.

title.children: Are modular homes the key to solving the ACT's housing crisis?

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone scrolling Facebook Marketplace.

props.synopsis: Savannah thought she had taken all the right steps to protect herself while selling items on Facebook Marketplace — but that did not stop her from being scammed. Here is what you need to know when buying and selling via online marketplaces.

title.children: Facebook Marketplace and Gumtree are full of scammers. Here is how to avoid them

image.altText: Julius Jungerth

props.synopsis: Hundreds of coin collectors forwent the late-night revelry of New Year's Eve in favour of an early morning visit to the Royal Australian Mint in Canberra, hoping to get their hands on the highly sought-after first coin of the year.

title.children: New coin celebrates 60 years of decimal currency

image.altText: Joe Root watches the ball after playing a shot

props.synopsis: Joe Root continues to add to his biggest score on Australian soil against the second new ball on day two. Follow live.

title.children: Root passes 150 as England counters against second new ball

image.altText: Novak Djokovic scratching his head with his racquet while on court.

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic is stepping away from the Professional Tennis Players Association citing concerns over transparency and governance within the organisation.

title.children: Djokovic quits players body he co-founded over transparency concerns

image.altText: Man with hand raised with political advertising behind him

props.synopsis: Sam Groth, the deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party, has announced he will not contest the upcoming state election in November, saying he made his decision after realising that some recent negative public pressure had come from within his own party.

title.children: Deputy Victorian Opposition Leader Sam Groth won't contest next election

image.altText: A composite image of an Australian $1 coin and an ASX board

props.synopsis: The value of Australia's currency could move significantly up or down depending on the direction of interest rates. But the global economic backdrop will also be crucial in determining its direction.

title.children: The Australian dollar is at a critical crossroads. Which way will it go?

image.altText: Australian currency

props.synopsis: Almost $300 million in refunds, dividends and cheques remain unclaimed by households and businesses across New South Wales, with locals urged to take action to secure the money they are owed.

title.children: 'We want to get that money back to you': $300m of unclaimed cash in NSW

image.altText: Green island surrounded by sea.

props.synopsis: Boasting thousands of years of history and a World Heritage listing, Okinoshima is Japan's very own treasure island. It's also completely off limits to women.

title.children: The island in Japan 'whose name cannot be spoken'

image.altText: A photo of womens footballers with arms crossed in huddle.

props.synopsis: A country football league president has been reported to the AFL Integrity Unit over alleged comments about a club's "grooming and gender weirdness" after it was involved in blocking the club from entering a neighbouring competition.

title.children: League president reported to AFL over 'gender weirdness' alleged comments

image.altText: Damien Martyn plays in the nets

props.synopsis: Former Australian Test batsman Damien Martyn is awake and talking after being in an induced coma for several days.

title.children: Damien Martyn awakes from coma in 'some sort of miracle', thanks public

image.altText: Zac Lomax ruins with the ball for the Eels during a 2025 NRL match.

props.synopsis: In the wake of Zac Lomax's sudden departure, Parramatta makes a move in the player market as it looks to lifts its fortunes.

title.children: Eels sign potential Lomax replacement ahead of 2026 NRL season

image.altText: A woman with glasses looks at the camera in front of a huge monstera plant in a rattan vase

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

title.children: Katherine may have 700 half-siblings. She's trying to find them to pass on medical advice

image.altText: two police officers walking down a deserted street from behind

props.synopsis: After years of negative headlines, crime rates in Alice Springs are showing signs of turning a corner but some locals remain worried the change could be short-lived.

title.children: Lower crime rates in Alice Springs leave many optimistic, others worried

image.altText: A young white boy with short brown hair with his mother, who has longer brown hair, playing with lego at a coffee table

props.synopsis: Developmental delay will be a big part of the new NDIS alternative for some kids. But what does the phrase mean and how can you tell if your child has one?

title.children: The signs your child might have a developmental delay

image.altText: Sarah Snook looking down at her Critics Choice awards, she's wearing a black suit with white shirt, hair tied back

props.synopsis: Australia's Sarah Snook takes out Best Actress in a Limited Series or Movie Made for Television with All Her Fault, while Jacob Elordi wins Best Supporting Actor for his performance in Frankenstein.

title.children: Jacob Elordi and Sarah Snook win at Critics Choice Awards

image.altText: A woman stands in the front door of a home, looking away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Community housing is seen as a way for the government to tackle the housing crisis, but between limited options and court orders, some people are falling through the cracks.

title.children: Woman who paid back debt faces community housing eviction amid 'other factors'

image.altText: A man sits on a chair on a deck out the front of a house. Beside him is a pair of crutches. A large stitch is on his right leg.

props.synopsis: Geraldton locals like Stuart Wise are calling for a crackdown on e-scooter safety, weeks after a man in his 30s died in an accident in the regional WA city.

title.children: Residents in WA city warn of e-scooter dangers ahead of contract decision

image.altText: Michele Bullock

props.synopsis: What are you watching in 2026 when it comes to the economy or markets? That's the question we put to the ABC's experts.

title.children: Inflation, tariffs, EVs: What the ABC's business experts are watching in 2026

image.altText: Image of a number of fallen trees in a green plantation.

props.synopsis: Questions are being raised about sustainable timber certification in Australia.

title.children: Sustainable timber certification under fire

image.altText: Toads put in a bucket

props.synopsis: On a tropical Queensland island, 'toad busters' have decided the cane toad's spread across northern Australia should not be a lost cause.

title.children: The toad busters determined to take back a tropical island from its invaders

image.altText: A woman's hands hold a key ring while resting on a park bench.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old NSW border resident says dismissive treatment in hospitals, long waits for care and limited access to services have pushed her away from support.

title.children: Patient says 'traumatising' hospital care deepened her mental health crisis

image.altText: A stylised portrait of LJ

props.synopsis: An Australian-first study finds evidence of previously undetected, long-term cognitive changes in women more than six months after they experienced repeated concussions and strangulation during intimate partner violence.

title.children: The hidden injuries linked to memory changes in family violence survivors

image.altText: Two men in a bar smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Social media users are showing off their intergenerational work friendships, but experts say the benefits are substantial.

title.children: How workplace generation gaps are leading to unlikely friendships

image.altText: a white car with the  boot door open after police found a man stabbed, beate, burnt, tied up inside

props.synopsis: The ABC understands a member of the public contacted police after hearing screams for help from the boot of a white car parked off Woodville Road in Sydney's west.

title.children: Man found in car boot tied up, stabbed, burnt and beaten

image.altText: A black and white photo of a cattleman standing in front of a helicopter.

props.synopsis: From building one of Queensland's most respected cattle empires and championing the Brahman breed, Sir Graham's lifelong dedication to agriculture and his community was truly remarkable.

title.children: Beef industry mourns loss of Sir Graham McCamley

image.altText: A young man wearing a cap and standing in front of a header.

props.synopsis: When 22-year-old Tanguy Bodiguel's friends said they were travelling to Australia, he left them in Sydney to work on a farm with sentimental value.

title.children: French farmer works the same Australian land his father did 30 years ago
